sen.j: 住友活機園（すみともかっきえん）は、滋賀県大津市にある歴史的建造物。
sen.e: Sumitomo Kakki-en Manor is a historical building located in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Sumitomo Kakki-en Manor is a historical building located in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Sumitomo Kakkien is a historical building located in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 住友財閥2代総理事・伊庭貞剛が引退後に居住した邸宅であり、明治時代後期を代表する邸宅建築である。
sen.e: The structure is a representative mansion of the late Meiji period and, the retirement residence of Mr. Sadatake IBA, the 2nd hereditary President of the Sumitomo zaibatsu (pre WWII business conglomerate).

The structure is a representative mansion of the late Meiji period and, the retirement residence of Mr. Sadatake IBA, the 2nd hereditary President of the Sumitomo zaibatsu (pre WWII business conglomerate).
The structure is a representative mansion of the late Meiji period and, the retirement residence of Teigo IBA, the 2nd hereditary President of the Sumitomo zaibatsu (pre WWII business conglomerate).

sen.j: 大津市田辺町10番14号に位置する。
sen.e: Sumitomo Kakki-en Manor is located at 10-4 Tanabe-cho, Otsu City.
Sumitomo Kakki-en Manor is located at 10-4 Tanabe-cho, Otsu City.
Sumitomo Kakkien is located at 10-4 Tanabe-cho, Otsu City.

sen.j: 伊庭貞剛は1904年（明治37年）にここに隠居し、1926年（大正15年）にこの地で没した。
sen.e: Sadatake IBA retired here in 1904 and passed away here in 1926.
Sadatake IBA retired here in 1904 and passed away here in 1926.
Teigo IBA retired here in 1904 and passed away here in 1926.

sen.j: 「活機」とは「俗世を離れながらも人情の機微に通じる」という意味。
sen.e: The word `Kakki` (活機) in Japanese means `even though we all depart this mortal life, the subtleties of empathy and human nature persist'.
The word `Kakki` (活機) in Japanese means `even though we all depart this mortal life, the subtleties of empathy and human nature persist'.
The meaning of the Japanese kanji used for the 'Kakki' part of 'Kakkien' is 'even in a life apart from the real world, we know the subtleties of human nature'.

sen.j: 洋館と和館、庭園からなり、「明治後期の大邸宅の姿を完全に伝える稀有な例」として2002年（平成14年）に建物6棟と土地が重要文化財に指定された。
sen.e: Displaying both Japanese and Western influences that meld into surrounding park and gardens, 6 buildings and grounds of Kakki-en were designated Important Cultural Property in 2002 by virtue that it ` is a rare example that completely conveys the style of a late-Meiji era mansion`.

Displaying both Japanese and Western influences that meld into surrounding park and gardens, 6 buildings and grounds of Kakki-en were designated Important Cultural Property in 2002 by virtue that it ` is a rare example that completely conveys the style of a late-Meiji era mansion`.

Consisting of Western-style house, Japanese-style house, and gardens, 6 buildings and grounds of Kakkien were designated Important Cultural Property in 2002 by virtue that 'it is a rare example that completely conveys the style of a late-Meiji era mansion'.

sen.j: 住友林業が所有し、住友不動産が管理。
sen.e: The property is owned by Sumitomo Forestry and managed by Sumitomo Realty.
The property is owned by Sumitomo Forestry and managed by Sumitomo Realty.
The property is owned by Sumitomo Forestry and managed by Sumitomo Realty.

sen.j: 維持管理費も住友グループ各社が拠出している。
sen.e: Various companies within the Sumitomo Group contribute to operation and maintenance costs.
Various companies within the Sumitomo Group contribute to operation and maintenance costs.
Various companies within the Sumitomo Group contribute to operation and maintenance costs.
- Designed by Magoichi NOGUCHI and built in 1904.
- Designed by Magoichi NOGUCHI and built in 1904.
- Designed by Magoichi NOGUCHI and built in 1904.
- Designed by Jinbee YAGI and built in 1904.
- Designed by Jinbee YAGI and built in 1904.
- Designed by Jinbee YAGI and built in 1904.
Lands (residential area and mountain forest area).

sen.j: 附指定: 茶室、四阿（あずまや）、鎮守堂
sen.e: Attached tea houses: Azuyama, Chinju-do Hall
Attached tea houses: Azuyama, Chinju-do Hall
Designated as a tsuketari: Tea house, Azumaya (square gazebo), Chinju-do Hall (a guardian god hall)
sen.cmt: ウィキペディアでは、「附指定: 茶室、四阿（あずまや）、鎮守堂」となっているため、それに合わせて原文・訳文を修正
